alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 5:59AM AKST until December 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... The first frontal band is over the far northern panhandle as of 5am. A break between fronts over the central panhandle where very light snow is happening with little accumulation. To the south, the second frontal band is progressing northward across Prince of Wales. This band will reach the Juneau area in the late afternoon, then weaken. A chance of freezing rain remains possible for some of the south-central outflow areas that remain below freezing Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Angoon, Juneau, Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, and surrounding areas. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility near downtown Juneau. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will continue to increase through Friday evening tapper off in the morning then increase again Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
